task: The user has been unable to send MMS messages using their messaging app for the past few hours. Customer name: John Smith, phone number: 555-123-2002, current location: abroad in France. They will consider the issue resolved when an MMS message can be successfully sent.

messages.content: Hi! I'm having trouble sending MMS messages using my messaging app‚Äîit's been happening for the past few hours. Could you help me figure out what's wrong and get it working again?

I can help with that. Before we begin troubleshooting, I need to verify your account.

Please provide one of the following:
- Your phone number, or
- Your full name and date of birth (YYYY-MM-DD)

Also, does this issue only happen when you‚Äôre connected to Wi-Fi, or also on mobile data? Are you currently traveling outside your usual home area?

Once I verify your account, here‚Äôs what we‚Äôll check to get MMS working:
- Make sure you have cellular service and mobile data enabled
- Confirm you‚Äôre on a compatible network (MMS needs at least 3G)
- Check and reset APN settings if needed
- Temporarily turn off Wi‚ÄëFi Calling (it can sometimes interfere with MMS)
- Ensure your messaging app has storage and SMS permissions
- Reboot your device if we make any settings changes

Share your verification details and answers to the questions above, and we‚Äôll get started.
messages.reasoning_content: Plan: Verify customer identity (phone number or name+DOB). Then guide through tech support diagnostic steps for MMS: ensure cellular service and mobile data are on; check network type (prefer 3G+); check roaming if abroad; check and reset APN settings; toggle Wi-Fi Calling off if needed; grant storage/SMS permissions to messaging app; reboot device; run can_send_mms and speed test. If service suspension suspected, check line status and handle overdue bills if applicable. Proceed step-by-step with minimal tools.

messages.content:
Sure! My phone number is 555-123-2002.

To answer your other questions:
Yes, I am currently abroad in France. The issue happens whether I'm on Wi-Fi or using mobile data. 

Let me know what you'd like me to check first!

messages.reasoning_content: User provided phone number and is abroad. Plan: 1) Look up customer by phone to verify identity and get customer_id and line_id. 2) Check line roaming status; if not enabled, enable roaming. 3) Guide user through step-by-step MMS troubleshooting starting with can_send_mms and basic diagnostics, then ensure mobile data and roaming are on, APN, Wi-Fi Calling off, network mode >= 3G, app permissions, and reboot if needed.

messages.content: Roaming enabled successfully

Thanks, John. I found your account and see you‚Äôre currently abroad. I‚Äôve just enabled roaming on your line (555-123-2002). Next, we‚Äôll check your device to get MMS working.

Please make sure you have your phone handy and let me know when you‚Äôre ready to run these checks. We‚Äôll go step by step.

Step 1: Quick status check
- On your phone, please run:
  - check_status_bar
  - check_network_status
  - can_send_mms

Share the results here. That will tell us if you have cellular signal, whether mobile data and data roaming are enabled, and if MMS is currently functional.

If you prefer, we can also adjust these settings together. After that, we‚Äôll verify APN settings, Wi‚ÄëFi Calling status, network mode, and messaging app permissions, and make any needed changes. If we update settings, I‚Äôll guide you to reboot the device at the end.

Let me know when you‚Äôre ready, and I‚Äôll start with those first three checks.
messages.reasoning_content: Now that roaming is enabled, instruct the user to ensure data roaming is ON on the device and walk through MMS troubleshooting steps using the available diagnostic tools: check_status_bar, check_network_status, check_data_restriction_status, check_apn_settings, check_wifi_calling_status, check_app_permissions, can_send_mms, and fix actions toggle_roaming, reset_apn_settings, toggle_wifi_calling, set_network_mode_preference, grant_app_permission, reboot_device. Also ask for confirmation when ready to proceed with device checks.

Your messaging app cannot send MMS messages.

Here are the results from the checks you asked for:

- Status bar shows that Airplane Mode is ON and battery level is at 80%.
- Network status says Airplane Mode is turned on, SIM card is missing, and there is no cellular service or signal. Mobile data and data roaming are enabled, but Wi-Fi is off and not connected.
- The messaging app cannot send MMS messages currently.

What would you like me to do next?

Thanks for the details. The main issue is that Airplane Mode is on and the SIM appears to be missing. Let‚Äôs fix this step by step.

1) Turn off Airplane Mode
- Please run: toggle_airplane_mode
- This will re-enable all wireless radios.

2) Re-seat the SIM card
- After Airplane Mode is off, please run: reseat_sim_card
- This ensures the SIM is properly detected.

3) Check status again
- Then run these to confirm things are back:
  - check_status_bar
  - check_network_status
  - can_send_mms

Please let me know the results. If you have cellular service and signal, but MMS still doesn‚Äôt work, we‚Äôll continue with APN settings, network mode, Wi‚ÄëFi Calling, and app permissions as needed.
messages.reasoning_content: Airplane mode is on and SIM appears missing. The immediate step is to have the user turn off Airplane Mode, then reseat the SIM, then rerun status/network checks. After that, proceed with network mode, APN, permissions, Wi-Fi calling, and reboot if needed.

messages.reasoning_content: User is abroad on 2G and MMS fails. Actions: set network mode to 4G/5G preferred to get off 2G, then recheck status and MMS. If still fails, check APN settings, and consider disabling Wi-Fi Calling if enabled, then reboot after APN changes.

messages.content: Error: Tool 'set_network_mode_preference' not found.

Got it. Being on a 2G network is likely why MMS isn‚Äôt working‚Äîit needs at least 3G. Since you‚Äôre abroad with a weak signal, let‚Äôs get your device onto a faster network and then adjust a few settings.

Step 1: Switch to 4G/5G network mode
- On your phone: go to Settings > Mobile Network/Cellular > Network Mode/Preferred network type
- Choose ‚Äú5G/4G/LTE‚Äù (or ‚Äú4G/5G preferred‚Äù). Avoid ‚Äú2G/3G only‚Äù or ‚Äú2G only.‚Äù
- After changing, wait 20‚Äì30 seconds to let it reconnect.

Step 2: Recheck status
- Please run again:
  - check_status_bar
  - check_network_status
  - can_send_mms

Tell me what network type it shows now and whether signal strength improved. If it‚Äôs still 2G or very weak, we can try toggling Airplane Mode once more to force a fresh network registration:
- Run toggle_airplane_mode to turn it on, wait 10 seconds, then run toggle_airplane_mode again to turn it off.

If you get a 3G/4G/5G connection and still can‚Äôt send MMS, we‚Äôll proceed to:
- Check APN settings and reset if needed
- Turn off Wi‚ÄëFi Calling temporarily
- Ensure messaging app permissions

Let me know the results after Step 2.
messages.reasoning_content: Guide the user to manually enable 4G/5G network mode via their phone‚Äôs settings since the tool is unavailable, then have them rerun check_status_bar, check_network_status, and can_send_mms. If still on 2G or MMS fails, proceed to check/reset APN and toggle Wi-Fi Calling.

After switching to the preferred 4G/5G network mode, here's what I see:

- Status bar now shows an excellent signal on a 5G network, data is enabled, and battery is at 80%.
- Network status confirms that Airplane Mode is off, SIM is active, cellular connection is good with excellent 5G signal, mobile data and roaming are both enabled, and Wi-Fi is off.
- Unfortunately, the messaging app still cannot send MMS messages.

What would you like to try next?

Great work getting to a solid 5G connection. Next, let‚Äôs check the APN settings, messaging app permissions, and Wi‚ÄëFi Calling‚Äîthose are the most common causes when you have signal but MMS still won‚Äôt work.

Please run these in order and share each result:

1) Check APN settings
- Run: check_apn_settings
- Tell me if the APN name looks correct and, importantly, whether the MMSC URL is set.

2) Check messaging app permissions
- Run: check_app_permissions with app_name set to ‚Äúmessaging‚Äù
- Let me know if ‚Äústorage‚Äù and ‚Äúsms‚Äù are granted.

3) Check Wi‚ÄëFi Calling status
- Run: check_wifi_calling_status
- Let me know if Wi‚ÄëFi Calling is ON or OFF.

Based on what you find, we‚Äôll do this:
- If the APN/ MMSC looks wrong or missing: I‚Äôll guide you to reset APN settings, then we‚Äôll reboot.
- If storage or SMS permissions are missing: I‚Äôll guide you to grant them.
- If Wi‚ÄëFi Calling is ON: We‚Äôll turn it OFF temporarily because it can interfere with MMS on some networks.

Also, for the test: please ensure Wi‚ÄëFi is off and you‚Äôre on mobile data when you try to send a picture message. Let me know the results from those three checks, and we‚Äôll continue.
messages.reasoning_content: MMS still fails despite 5G signal and roaming enabled. Next steps per tech policy: check APN settings (MMSC URL), check messaging app permissions (storage, SMS), and try toggling Wi‚ÄëFi Calling off if it's on. Reset APN if incorrect, then reboot. Also try a quick test on Wi‚ÄëFi to isolate, but messaging app needs mobile data for MMS; ask user to ensure mobile data is on while testing.

(These are technical settings, usually best left unchanged.)

Here are the results from the checks:

1. APN settings: The APN name is "internet," and the MMSC URL is present‚Äî"http://mms.carrier.com/mms/wapenc."
2. Messaging app permissions: Both "storage" and "sms" permissions are granted (along with phone).
3. Wi-Fi Calling status: Wi-Fi Calling is currently ON.

Wi-Fi is off, and I'm on mobile data as you requested. Let me know if you want me to turn off Wi-Fi Calling or try something else next.

Thanks for the detailed results. Since everything else looks good and Wi‚ÄëFi Calling is ON, let‚Äôs turn it off‚Äîthis often resolves MMS issues when roaming.

1) Turn off Wi‚ÄëFi Calling
- Run: toggle_wifi_calling
- Wait about 10‚Äì15 seconds after it turns off.

2) Test MMS again
- Try sending a picture message on mobile data.

3) Recheck MMS capability
- Run: can_send_mms

Please let me know if the message goes through and what can_send_mms reports. If it still fails, we‚Äôll reset the APN settings and reboot the device to ensure everything is properly refreshed.
messages.reasoning_content: User is abroad with 5G, roaming enabled, and APN with MMSC present, but Wi-Fi Calling is ON and MMS fails. Next step per policy: turn off Wi-Fi Calling, then test MMS again and re-run can_send_mms. If still failing, consider resetting APN and reboot.

1) Reset APN settings

2) Reboot the device

3) Verify and test

  - can_send_mms
- Then try sending a picture message on mobile data.

Please share the results from those checks and let me know if the MMS sends this time. If it still doesn‚Äôt work after the APN reset and reboot, I‚Äôll escalate you to our technical support team for deeper configuration assistance.
